newsitem.title: UK: British Steel gains after ADR strength.
newsitem.headline: British Steel gains after ADR strength.

text.p: Shares in British Steel crept higher in an otherwise bearish market on Wednesday, buoyed by overnight buying in the U.S., dealers said.

By 0920 GMT, the stock was up 3-3/4p, or 2.3 percent, at 169-1/4, making it the biggest percentage gainer among largely tumbling blue chip FTSE-100 stocks. British Steel ADRs rose $1-3/8 on Wall Street to $28-1/4.
"There was a bit of buying from New York last night," said one market-maker in the stock. "We're just going with the flow."
British Steel shares have lagged the rest of the UK market in recent months, dropping to a 12-month intraday low of 155p on December 6.
